Based on the user preference cues of genre, director, writer and plot keywords, I would recommend both "Bloody Sunday" and "The Twilight Saga: New Moon". 

"Bloody Sunday" is a drama film directed by Peter Weir and released in 1972. The film stars Tim Pigott-Smith as Michael Curran, Denzel Washington as John Creagh and Edward Fox as Sir John Curran. The plot follows the story of Michael Curran, a member of the Irish Republican Army who is involved in a secret operation to assassinate the Lord Provisor of Canada who is visiting London. 18 months later, Michael's brother, John, is arrested and charged with murder for the sake of an ideology. 

"The Twilight Saga: New Moon" is a science fiction film directed by Chris Weeninga and released in 2009. The film stars Taylor Lautner as Jacob Black, Kristen Stewart as Bella Swan, Robert Pattinson as Edward Cullen, Brian Johnson as Billy Jack, James Earl Jones as Mafa the Great, Chloë Grace Moretz as Esme, Anna Kendrick as Sam, Emma Stone as Mia, Max Irons as Jason, Michael Madsen as Marcus, Patrick Wilson as Patrick and Chris Weeninga and Andrew Lascelles and Tim Prost. 

The plot follows the story of Bella Swan, a high school student from Forks, Washington who has always been interested in meeting new people and having fun. 

One day, while on her way to class, Bella happens upon a group of young men sitting around a fire pit. One of the young men, Jacob Black, approaches Bella and introduces himself as one of the young men who are sitting around the fire pit. Jacob then tells Bella that he is looking for someone to help him in his search for answers about his family's past and how it relates to his own identity.
